thread.title: New on TV this week: Oct. 18-24 - TV
thread.title_full: New on TV this week: Oct. 18-24 - TV - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: New on TV this week: Oct. 18-24 - TV
text:
Series premieres: 
* Sweat Inc. — A new reality series that has former "The Biggest Loser" trainer Jillian Michaels searching for America's next fitness craze. Passionate entrepreneurs compete to win $100,000 and a chance to launch their workout concept in gyms across the nation. 10 p.m. Tuesday, SpikeTV.
* Hellevator — Be afraid. Be very afraid. From the twisted minds that brought you "Paranormal Activity" comes "Hellevator." It's a game show that challenges contestants to ride a haunted elevator and complete terrifying tasks before time runs out on them. 8 p.m. Wednesday, GSN.
* Pacific Warriors — Come for the beautiful scenery — and stay for the tense drama. It's a six-part series that follows brave men and women in Hawaii who are out to hook monster fish while floating in nothing more than small sea kayaks. 10 p.m. Friday, Discovery Channel.
Season debuts: 
* Being Mary Jane — Uh-oh. There's even more turbulence for TV anchorwoman Mary Jane Paul (Gabrielle Union) as season three of this addictive drama begins. She's recovering from a horrific car crash that occurred right after learning that on-again, off-again lover David (Stephen Bishop) and best friend Lisa (Latarsha Rose) have hooked up in the past. Adding salt to the wounds is Mary Jane's young and sexy on-air (Daniella Alonso) replacement, who has become an instant sensation while she recovers from the accident. 9 p.m. Tuesday, BET.
* Da Vinci's Demons — When the third and final season begins, Leonardo da Vinci's (Tom Riley) world is about to come crashing down as the city of Otranto is brutalized by an Ottoman invasion. Even worse, the enemy is using weapons inspired by Leo's own secret blueprints. 8 p.m. Saturday, Starz.
Worth watching: 
* Heroes Reborn — There's a familiar face as fan favorite Masi Oka returns in the role of Hiro Nakamura. Meanwhile, Noah Bennet (Jack Coleman) takes matters in his own hands to get the answers he seeks. 8 p.m. Thursday, NBC.
— From news service reports
